Others: The Boston Celtics defeated the Denver Nuggets 118-106.
The Celtics' victory was achieved despite attempting a season-low 35 three-pointers and making only 12.
The absence of Nikola Jokic from the Nuggets' lineup led to the Celtics focusing on scoring in the paint, where they outscored the Nuggets 60-46.
Kristaps Porziņģis had a standout performance for the Celtics, scoring 25 points, grabbing 11 rebounds, and recording 2 steals and a block.
Porziņģis scored 20 of his 25 points in the restricted area or at the free throw line, causing problems for the Nuggets' smaller lineup.
Celtics head coach Joe Mazzulla praised Porziņģis' performance, noting his physicality and intentionality in getting into the paint.
